Dear list,

just pulled the most recent snapshot of 3.1.1 and noticed
that there is still an error in .cxml files.

engine/src/main/resources/org/archive/crawler/restlet/profile-crawler-beans.cxml
The canonicalizationPolicy should have a property around the list.

 <!-- CANONICALIZATION POLICY -->
 <!--
 <bean id="canonicalizationPolicy"
   class="org.archive.modules.canonicalize.RulesCanonicalizationPolicy">
   <property name="rules">
    <list>
     <bean class="org.archive.modules.canonicalize.LowercaseRule" />
     <bean class="org.archive.modules.canonicalize.StripUserinfoRule" />
     <bean class="org.archive.modules.canonicalize.StripWWWNRule" />
     <bean class="org.archive.modules.canonicalize.StripSessionIDs" />
     <bean class="org.archive.modules.canonicalize.StripSessionCFIDs" />
     <bean class="org.archive.modules.canonicalize.FixupQueryString" />
    </list>
  </property>
 </bean>
 -->

And what is up with
engine/src/main/resources/org/archive/crawler/migrate/migrate-template-crawler-beans.cxml
should it also have a property around the list?

This is in the sources and after compiling it goes into heritrix-3.1.1-SNAPSHOT.jar.
It will result in an error in crawler-beans.cxml if a new job is created and canonicalizationPolicy is used.

Nothing serious, but would be pleased to have this fixed
and not always having to add the property to crawler-beans.cxml
if using canonicalizationPolicy.

Regards,
Bernd
